fields.description:
Currently it's all-or-nothing, and to do the subsetting in pandas incurs a data copy. This would enable columns (by name or index) to be selected out without additional data copying. We should add a {{columns=}} argument to the the {{from_pandas}} calls and do the subsetting when we dispatch the individual arrays for conversion to Arrow.

cc [~cpcloud] [~jreback]
fields.summary: [Python] Provide for selecting a subset of columns to convert in RecordBatch/Table.from_pandas

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #1924: ARROW-1731: add columns selector in Table.from_array
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1924#discussion_r183217739
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/table.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -1263,6 +1270,28 @@ cdef class Table:
 
         return pyarrow_wrap_table(c_table)
 
+    def drop(self, columns):
+        """
+        Drop one or more columns and return a new table.
+        """
+        indices = []
+        for col in columns:
+            idx = self.schema.get_field_index(col)
+            if idx == -1:
+                raise KeyError("Column {!r} not found".format(col))
+            indices.append(idx)
+
+        indices.sort()
+        indices.reverse()
+
+        for i, idx in enumerate(indices):
+            if i == 0:
+                table = self.remove_column(idx)
 
 Review comment:
   A nit: if you write `table = self` before the loop, you can dispense with this special case.
